definitions.definition: A cause of worry ; that which is grievous, wearisome, or oppressive.
The capacity of a vessel, or the weight of cargo that she will carry.
examples: a ship of a hundred tons burden

definitions.definition: ( mining ) The tops or heads of stream-work which lie over the stream of tin .
( metalworking ) The proportion of ore and flux to fuel , in the charge of a blast furnace .
A fixed quantity of certain commodities.
examples: A burden of gad steel is 120 pounds.
… that bore thee at a burden two fair sons.

definitions.definition: ( medicine ) The total amount of toxins, parasites, cancer cells, plaque or similar present in an organism.
( blasting ) The distance between rows of blastholes parallel to the major free face (i.e. face of the excavation)

definitions.definition: A phrase or theme that recurs at the end of each verse in a folk song or ballad .

main_definition: ( music ) A phrase or theme that recurs at the end of each verse in a folk song or ballad .
